Control Short Name: Utilize an Active Discovery Tool
Control Long Name: Utilize an Active Discovery Tool
Control Description: Utilize an active discovery tool to identify devices connected to the organization's network and update the hardware asset inventory.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Hardware Assets

Control Short Name: Use a Passive Asset Discovery Tool
Control Long Name: Use a Passive Asset Discovery Tool
Control Description: Utilize a passive discovery tool to identify devices connected to the organization's network and automatically update the organization's hardware asset inventory.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Hardware Assets

Control Short Name: Use DHCP Logging to Update Asset Inventory
Control Long Name: Use DHCP Logging to Update Asset Inventory
Control Description: Use Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) logging on all DHCP servers or IP address management tools to update the organization's hardware asset inventory.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Hardware Assets

Control Short Name: Maintain Detailed Asset Inventory
Control Long Name: Maintain Detailed Asset Inventory
Control Description: Maintain an accurate and up-to-date inventory of all technology assets with the potential to store or process information. This inventory shall include all hardware assets, whether connected to the organization's network or not.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Hardware Assets

Control Short Name: Maintain Asset Inventory Information
Control Long Name: Maintain Asset Inventory Information
Control Description: Ensure that the hardware asset inventory records the network address, hardware address, machine name, data asset owner, and department for each asset and whether the hardware asset has been approved to connect to the network.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Hardware Assets

Control Short Name: Address Unauthorized Assets
Control Long Name: Address Unauthorized Assets
Control Description: Ensure that unauthorized assets are either removed from the network, quarantined or the inventory is updated in a timely manner.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Hardware Assets

Control Short Name: Deploy Port Level Access Control
Control Long Name: Deploy Port Level Access Control
Control Description: Utilize port level access control, following 802.1x standards, to control which devices can authenticate to the network. The authentication system shall be tied into the hardware asset inventory data to ensure only authorized devices can connect to the network.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Hardware Assets

Control Short Name: Utilize Client Certificates to Authenticate Hardware Assets
Control Long Name: Utilize Client Certificates to Authenticate Hardware Assets
Control Description: Use client certificates to authenticate hardware assets connecting to the organization's trusted network.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Hardware Assets

Control Short Name: Maintain Inventory of Authorized Software
Control Long Name: Maintain Inventory of Authorized Software
Control Description: Maintain an up-to-date list of all authorized software that is required in the enterprise for any business purpose on any business system.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

Control Short Name: Ensure Software is Supported by Vendor
Control Long Name: Ensure Software is Supported by Vendor
Control Description: Ensure that only software applications or operating systems currently supported by the software's vendor are added to the organization's authorized software inventory. Unsupported software should be tagged as unsupported in the inventory system.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

Control Short Name: Utilize Software Inventory Tools
Control Long Name: Utilize Software Inventory Tools
Control Description: Utilize software inventory tools throughout the organization to automate the documentation of all software on business systems.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

Control Short Name: Track Software Inventory Information
Control Long Name: Track Software Inventory Information
Control Description: The software inventory system should track the name, version, publisher, and install date for all software, including operating systems authorized by the organization.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

Control Short Name: Integrate Software and Hardware Asset Inventories
Control Long Name: Integrate Software and Hardware Asset Inventories
Control Description: The software inventory system should be tied into the hardware asset inventory so all devices and associated software are tracked from a single location.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

Control Short Name: Address unapproved software
Control Long Name: Address unapproved software
Control Description: Ensure that unauthorized software is either removed or the inventory is updated in a timely manner
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

Control Short Name: Utilize Application Whitelisting
Control Long Name: Utilize Application Whitelisting
Control Description: Utilize application whitelisting technology on all assets to ensure that only authorized software executes and all unauthorized software is blocked from executing on assets.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

Control Short Name: Implement Application Whitelisting of Libraries
Control Long Name: Implement Application Whitelisting of Libraries
Control Description: The organization's application whitelisting software must ensure that only authorized software libraries (such as *.dll, *.ocx, *.so, etc) are allowed to load into a system process.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

Control Short Name: Implement Application Whitelisting of Scripts
Control Long Name: Implement Application Whitelisting of Scripts
Control Description:
The organization's application whitelisting software must ensure that only authorized, digitally signed scripts (such as *.ps1, 
 *.py, macros, etc) are allowed to run on a system.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

Control Short Name: Physically or Logically Segregate High Risk Applications
Control Long Name: Physically or Logically Segregate High Risk Applications
Control Description: Physically or logically segregated systems should be used to isolate and run software that is required for business operations but incur higher risk for the organization.
Control Family: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

Control Short Name: Run Automated Vulnerability Scanning Tools
Control Long Name: Run Automated Vulnerability Scanning Tools
Control Description: Utilize an up-to-date SCAP-compliant vulnerability scanning tool to automatically scan all systems on the network on a weekly or more frequent basis to identify all potential vulnerabilities on the organization's systems.

Control Short Name: Perform Authenticated Vulnerability Scanning
Control Long Name: Perform Authenticated Vulnerability Scanning
Control Description: Perform authenticated vulnerability scanning with agents running locally on each system or with remote scanners that are configured with elevated rights on the system being tested.

Control Short Name: Protect Dedicated Assessment Accounts
Control Long Name: Protect Dedicated Assessment Accounts
Control Description: Use a dedicated account for authenticated vulnerability scans, which should not be used for any other administrative activities and should be tied to specific machines at specific IP addresses.

Control Short Name: Deploy Automated Operating System Patch Management Tools
Control Long Name: Deploy Automated Operating System Patch Management Tools
Control Description: Deploy automated software update tools in order to ensure that the operating systems are running the most recent security updates provided by the software vendor.

Control Short Name: Deploy Automated Software Patch Management Tools
Control Long Name: Deploy Automated Software Patch Management Tools
Control Description: Deploy automated software update tools in order to ensure that third-party software on all systems is running the most recent security updates provided by the software vendor.

Control Short Name: Compare Back-to-back Vulnerability Scans
Control Long Name: Compare Back-to-back Vulnerability Scans
Control Description: Regularly compare the results from back-to-back vulnerability scans to verify that vulnerabilities have been remediated in a timely manner.

Control Short Name: Utilize a Risk-rating Process
Control Long Name: Utilize a Risk-rating Process
Control Description: Utilize a risk-rating process to prioritize the remediation of discovered vulnerabilities.

Control Short Name: Maintain Inventory of Administrative Accounts
Control Long Name: Maintain Inventory of Administrative Accounts
Control Description: Use automated tools to inventory all administrative accounts, including domain and local accounts, to ensure that only authorized individuals have elevated privileges.

Control Short Name: Change Default Passwords
Control Long Name: Change Default Passwords
Control Description: Before deploying any new asset, change all default passwords to have values consistent with administrative level accounts.

Control Short Name: Ensure the Use of Dedicated Administrative Accounts
Control Long Name: Ensure the Use of Dedicated Administrative Accounts
Control Description: Ensure that all users with administrative account access use a dedicated or secondary account for elevated activities. This account should only be used for administrative activities and not internet browsing, email, or similar activities.

Control Short Name: Use Unique Passwords
Control Long Name: Use Unique Passwords
Control Description: Where multi-factor authentication is not supported (such as local administrator, root, or service accounts), accounts will use passwords that are unique to that system.

Control Short Name: Use Multifactor Authentication For All Administrative Access
Control Long Name: Use Multifactor Authentication For All Administrative Access
Control Description: Use multi-factor authentication and encrypted channels for all administrative account access.

Control Short Name: Use of Dedicated Machines For All Administrative Tasks
Control Long Name: Use of Dedicated Machines For All Administrative Tasks
Control Description: Ensure administrators use a dedicated machine for all administrative tasks or tasks requiring administrative access. This machine will be segmented from the organization's primary network and not be allowed Internet access. This machine will not be used for reading e-mail, composing documents, or browsing the Internet.

Control Short Name: Limit Access to Script Tools
Control Long Name: Limit Access to Script Tools
Control Description: Limit access to scripting tools (such as Microsoft PowerShell and Python) to only administrative or development users with the need to access those capabilities.

Control Short Name: Log and Alert on Changes to Administrative Group Membership
Control Long Name: Log and Alert on Changes to Administrative Group Membership
Control Description: Configure systems to issue a log entry and alert when an account is added to or removed from any group assigned administrative privileges.

Control Short Name: Log and Alert on Unsuccessful Administrative Account Login
Control Long Name: Log and Alert on Unsuccessful Administrative Account Login
Control Description: Configure systems to issue a log entry and alert on unsuccessful logins to an administrative account.

Control Short Name: Establish Secure Configurations
Control Long Name: Establish Secure Configurations
Control Description: Maintain documented, standard security configuration standards for all authorized operating systems and software.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Hardware and Software on Mobile Devices, Laptops, Workstations and Servers

Control Short Name: Maintain Secure Images
Control Long Name: Maintain Secure Images
Control Description: Maintain secure images or templates for all systems in the enterprise based on the organization's approved configuration standards. Any new system deployment or existing system that becomes compromised should be imaged using one of those images or templates.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Hardware and Software on Mobile Devices, Laptops, Workstations and Servers

Control Short Name: Securely Store Master Images
Control Long Name: Securely Store Master Images
Control Description: Store the master images and templates on securely configured servers, validated with integrity monitoring tools, to ensure that only authorized changes to the images are possible.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Hardware and Software on Mobile Devices, Laptops, Workstations and Servers

Control Short Name: Deploy System Configuration Management Tools
Control Long Name: Deploy System Configuration Management Tools
Control Description: Deploy system configuration management tools that will automatically enforce and redeploy configuration settings to systems at regularly scheduled intervals.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Hardware and Software on Mobile Devices, Laptops, Workstations and Servers

Control Short Name: Implement Automated Configuration Monitoring Systems
Control Long Name: Implement Automated Configuration Monitoring Systems
Control Description: Utilize a Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) compliant configuration monitoring system to verify all security configuration elements, catalog approved exceptions, and alert when unauthorized changes occur.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Hardware and Software on Mobile Devices, Laptops, Workstations and Servers

Control Short Name: Utilize Three Synchronized Time Sources
Control Long Name: Utilize Three Synchronized Time Sources
Control Description: Use at least three synchronized time sources from which all servers and network devices retrieve time information on a regular basis so that timestamps in logs are consistent.
Control Family: Maintenance, Monitoring and Analysis of Audit Logs

Control Short Name: Activate audit logging
Control Long Name: Activate audit logging
Control Description: Ensure that local logging has been enabled on all systems and networking devices.
Control Family: Maintenance, Monitoring and Analysis of Audit Logs

Control Short Name: Enable Detailed Logging
Control Long Name: Enable Detailed Logging
Control Description: Enable system logging to include detailed information such as a event source, date, user, timestamp, source addresses, destination addresses, and other useful elements.
Control Family: Maintenance, Monitoring and Analysis of Audit Logs

Control Short Name: Ensure adequate storage for logs
Control Long Name: Ensure adequate storage for logs
Control Description: Ensure that all systems that store logs have adequate storage space for the logs generated.
Control Family: Maintenance, Monitoring and Analysis of Audit Logs

Control Short Name: Central Log Management
Control Long Name: Central Log Management
Control Description: Ensure that appropriate logs are being aggregated to a central log management system for analysis and review.
Control Family: Maintenance, Monitoring and Analysis of Audit Logs

Control Short Name: Deploy SIEM or Log Analytic tool
Control Long Name: Deploy SIEM or Log Analytic tool
Control Description: Deploy Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) or log analytic tool for log correlation and analysis.
Control Family: Maintenance, Monitoring and Analysis of Audit Logs

Control Short Name: Regularly Review Logs
Control Long Name: Regularly Review Logs
Control Description: On a regular basis, review logs to identify anomalies or abnormal events.
Control Family: Maintenance, Monitoring and Analysis of Audit Logs

Control Short Name: Regularly Tune SIEM
Control Long Name: Regularly Tune SIEM
Control Description: On a regular basis, tune your SIEM system to better identify actionable events and decrease event noise.
Control Family: Maintenance, Monitoring and Analysis of Audit Logs

Control Short Name: Ensure Use of Only Fully Supported Browsers and Email Clients
Control Long Name: Ensure Use of Only Fully Supported Browsers and Email Clients
Control Description: Ensure that only fully supported web browsers and email clients are allowed to execute in the organization, ideally only using the latest version of the browsers and email clients provided by the vendor.

Control Short Name: Disable Unnecessary or Unauthorized Browser or Email Client Plugins
Control Long Name: Disable Unnecessary or Unauthorized Browser or Email Client Plugins
Control Description: Uninstall or disable any unauthorized browser or email client plugins or add-on applications.

Control Short Name: Limit Use of Scripting Languages in Web Browsers and Email Clients
Control Long Name: Limit Use of Scripting Languages in Web Browsers and Email Clients
Control Description: Ensure that only authorized scripting languages are able to run in all web browsers and email clients.

Control Short Name: Maintain and Enforce Network-Based URL Filters
Control Long Name: Maintain and Enforce Network-Based URL Filters
Control Description: Enforce network-based URL filters that limit a system's ability to connect to websites not approved by the organization. This filtering shall be enforced for each of the organization's systems, whether they are physically at an organization's facilities or not.

Control Short Name: Subscribe to URL-Categorization service
Control Long Name: Subscribe to URL-Categorization service
Control Description: Subscribe to URL categorization services to ensure that they are up-to-date with the most recent website category definitions available. Uncategorized sites shall be blocked by default.

Control Short Name: Log all URL requests
Control Long Name: Log all URL requests
Control Description: Log all URL requests from each of the organization's systems, whether onsite or a mobile device, in order to identify potentially malicious activity and assist incident handlers with identifying potentially compromised systems.

Control Short Name: Use of DNS Filtering Services
Control Long Name: Use of DNS Filtering Services
Control Description: Use DNS filtering services to help block access to known malicious domains.

Control Short Name: Implement DMARC and Enable Receiver-Side Verification
Control Long Name: Implement DMARC and Enable Receiver-Side Verification
Control Description: To lower the chance of spoofed or modified emails from valid domains, implement Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) policy and verification, starting by implementing the Sender Policy Framework (SPF) and the DomainKeys Identified Mail(DKIM) standards.

Control Short Name: Block Unnecessary File Types
Control Long Name: Block Unnecessary File Types
Control Description: Block all e-mail attachments entering the organization's e-mail gateway if the file types are unnecessary for the organization's business.

Control Short Name: Sandbox All Email Attachments
Control Long Name: Sandbox All Email Attachments
Control Description: Use sandboxing to analyze and block inbound email attachments with malicious behavior.

Control Short Name: Utilize Centrally Managed Anti-malware Software
Control Long Name: Utilize Centrally Managed Anti-malware Software
Control Description: Utilize centrally managed anti-malware software to continuously monitor and defend each of the organization's workstations and servers.

Control Short Name: Ensure Anti-Malware Software and Signatures are Updated
Control Long Name: Ensure Anti-Malware Software and Signatures are Updated
Control Description: Ensure that the organization's anti-malware software updates its scanning engine and signature database on a regular basis.

Control Short Name: Enable Operating System Anti-Exploitation Features/ Deploy Anti-Exploit Technologies
Control Long Name: Enable Operating System Anti-Exploitation Features/ Deploy Anti-Exploit Technologies
Control Description: Enable anti-exploitation features such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP) or Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) that are available in an operating system or deploy appropriate toolkits that can be configured to apply protection to a broader set of applications and executables.

Control Short Name: Configure Anti-Malware Scanning of Removable Devices
Control Long Name: Configure Anti-Malware Scanning of Removable Devices
Control Description: Configure devices so that they automatically conduct an anti-malware scan of removable media when inserted or connected.

Control Short Name: Configure Devices Not To Auto-run Content
Control Long Name: Configure Devices Not To Auto-run Content
Control Description: Configure devices to not auto-run content from removable media.

Control Short Name: Centralize Anti-malware Logging
Control Long Name: Centralize Anti-malware Logging
Control Description: Send all malware detection events to enterprise anti-malware administration tools and event log servers for analysis and alerting.

Control Short Name: Enable DNS Query Logging
Control Long Name: Enable DNS Query Logging
Control Description: Enable Domain Name System (DNS) query logging to detect hostname lookups for known malicious domains.

Control Short Name: Enable Command-line Audit Logging
Control Long Name: Enable Command-line Audit Logging
Control Description: Enable command-line audit logging for command shells, such as Microsoft Powershell and Bash.

Control Short Name: Associate Active Ports, Services and Protocols to Asset Inventory
Control Long Name: Associate Active Ports, Services and Protocols to Asset Inventory
Control Description: Associate active ports, services and protocols to the hardware assets in the asset inventory.
Control Family: Limitation and Control of Network Ports, Protocols, and Services

Control Short Name: Ensure Only Approved Ports, Protocols and Services Are Running
Control Long Name: Ensure Only Approved Ports, Protocols and Services Are Running
Control Description: Ensure that only network ports, protocols, and services listening on a system with validated business needs, are running on each system.
Control Family: Limitation and Control of Network Ports, Protocols, and Services

Control Short Name: Perform Regular Automated Port Scans
Control Long Name: Perform Regular Automated Port Scans
Control Description: Perform automated port scans on a regular basis against all systems and alert if unauthorized ports are detected on a system.
Control Family: Limitation and Control of Network Ports, Protocols, and Services

Control Short Name: Apply Host-based Firewalls or Port Filtering
Control Long Name: Apply Host-based Firewalls or Port Filtering
Control Description: Apply host-based firewalls or port filtering tools on end systems, with a default-deny rule that drops all traffic except those services and ports that are explicitly allowed.
Control Family: Limitation and Control of Network Ports, Protocols, and Services

Control Short Name: Implement Application Firewalls
Control Long Name: Implement Application Firewalls
Control Description: Place application firewalls in front of any critical servers to verify and validate the traffic going to the server. Any unauthorized traffic should be blocked and logged.
Control Family: Limitation and Control of Network Ports, Protocols, and Services

Control Short Name: Ensure Regular Automated Back Ups
Control Long Name: Ensure Regular Automated Back Ups
Control Description: Ensure that all system data is automatically backed up on regular basis.

Control Short Name: Perform Complete System Backups
Control Long Name: Perform Complete System Backups
Control Description: Ensure that each of the organization's key systems are backed up as a complete system, through processes such as imaging, to enable the quick recovery of an entire system.

Control Short Name: Test Data on Backup Media
Control Long Name: Test Data on Backup Media
Control Description: Test data integrity on backup media on a regular basis by performing a data restoration process to ensure that the backup is properly working.

Control Short Name: Ensure Protection of Backups
Control Long Name: Ensure Protection of Backups
Control Description: Ensure that backups are properly protected via physical security or encryption when they are stored, as well as when they are moved across the network. This includes remote backups and cloud services.

Control Short Name: Ensure Backups Have At least One Non-Continuously Addressable Destination
Control Long Name: Ensure Backups Have At least One Non-Continuously Addressable Destination
Control Description: Ensure that all backups have at least one backup destination that is not continuously addressable through operating system calls.

Control Short Name: Maintain Standard Security Configurations for Network Devices
Control Long Name: Maintain Standard Security Configurations for Network Devices
Control Description: Maintain standard, documented security configuration standards for all authorized network devices.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Network Devices, such as Firewalls, Routers and Switches

Control Short Name: Document Traffic Configuration Rules
Control Long Name: Document Traffic Configuration Rules
Control Description: All configuration rules that allow traffic to flow through network devices should be documented in a configuration management system with a specific business reason for each rule, a specific individual’s name responsible for that business need, and an expected duration of the need.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Network Devices, such as Firewalls, Routers and Switches

Control Short Name: Use Automated Tools to Verify Standard Device Configurations and Detect Changes
Control Long Name: Use Automated Tools to Verify Standard Device Configurations and Detect Changes
Control Description: Compare all network device configuration against approved security configurations defined for each network device in use and alert when any deviations are discovered.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Network Devices, such as Firewalls, Routers and Switches

Control Short Name: Install the Latest Stable Version of Any Security-related Updates on All Network Devices
Control Long Name: Install the Latest Stable Version of Any Security-related Updates on All Network Devices
Control Description: Install the latest stable version of any security-related updates on all network devices.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Network Devices, such as Firewalls, Routers and Switches

Control Short Name: Manage Network Devices Using Multi-Factor Authentication and Encrypted Sessions
Control Long Name: Manage Network Devices Using Multi-Factor Authentication and Encrypted Sessions
Control Description: Manage all network devices using multi-factor authentication and encrypted sessions.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Network Devices, such as Firewalls, Routers and Switches

Control Short Name: Use Dedicated Machines For All Network Administrative Tasks
Control Long Name: Use Dedicated Machines For All Network Administrative Tasks
Control Description: Ensure network engineers use a dedicated machine for all administrative tasks or tasks requiring elevated access. This machine shall be segmented from the organization's primary network and not be allowed Internet access. This machine shall not be used for reading e-mail, composing documents, or surfing the Internet.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Network Devices, such as Firewalls, Routers and Switches

Control Short Name: Manage Network Infrastructure Through a Dedicated Network
Control Long Name: Manage Network Infrastructure Through a Dedicated Network
Control Description: Manage the network infrastructure across network connections that are separated from the business use of that network, relying on separate VLANs or, preferably, on entirely different physical connectivity for management sessions for network devices.
Control Family: Secure Configuration for Network Devices, such as Firewalls, Routers and Switches

Control Short Name: Maintain an Inventory of Network Boundaries
Control Long Name: Maintain an Inventory of Network Boundaries
Control Description: Maintain an up-to-date inventory of all of the organization's network boundaries.

Control Short Name: Scan for Unauthorized Connections across Trusted Network Boundaries
Control Long Name: Scan for Unauthorized Connections across Trusted Network Boundaries
Control Description: Perform regular scans from outside each trusted network boundary to detect any unauthorized connections which are accessible across the boundary.

Control Short Name: Deny Communications with Known Malicious IP Addresses
Control Long Name: Deny Communications with Known Malicious IP Addresses
Control Description: Deny communications with known malicious or unused Internet IP addresses and limit access only to trusted and necessary IP address ranges at each of the organization's network boundaries,.

Control Short Name: Deny Communication over Unauthorized Ports
Control Long Name: Deny Communication over Unauthorized Ports
Control Description: Deny communication over unauthorized TCP or UDP ports or application traffic to ensure that only authorized protocols are allowed to cross the network boundary in or out of the network at each of the organization's network boundaries.

Control Short Name: Configure Monitoring Systems to Record Network Packets
Control Long Name: Configure Monitoring Systems to Record Network Packets
Control Description: Configure monitoring systems to record network packets passing through the boundary at each of the organization's network boundaries.

Control Short Name: Deploy Network-based IDS Sensor
Control Long Name: Deploy Network-based IDS Sensor
Control Description: Deploy network-based Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) sensors to look for unusual attack mechanisms and detect compromise of these systems at each of the organization's network boundaries.

Control Short Name: Deploy Network-Based Intrusion Prevention Systems
Control Long Name: Deploy Network-Based Intrusion Prevention Systems
Control Description: Deploy network-based Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS) to block malicious network traffic at each of the organization's network boundaries.

Control Short Name: Deploy NetFlow Collection on Networking Boundary Devices
Control Long Name: Deploy NetFlow Collection on Networking Boundary Devices
Control Description: Enable the collection of NetFlow and logging data on all network boundary devices.

Control Short Name: Deploy Application Layer Filtering Proxy Server
Control Long Name: Deploy Application Layer Filtering Proxy Server
Control Description: Ensure that all network traffic to or from the Internet passes through an authenticated application layer proxy that is configured to filter unauthorized connections.

Control Short Name: Decrypt Network Traffic at Proxy
Control Long Name: Decrypt Network Traffic at Proxy
Control Description: Decrypt all encrypted network traffic at the boundary proxy prior to analyzing the content. However, the organization may use whitelists of allowed sites that can be accessed through the proxy without decrypting the traffic.

Control Short Name: Require All Remote Login to Use Multi-factor Authentication
Control Long Name: Require All Remote Login to Use Multi-factor Authentication
Control Description: Require all remote login access to the organization's network to encrypt data in transit and use multi-factor authentication.

Control Short Name: Manage All Devices Remotely Logging into Internal Network
Control Long Name: Manage All Devices Remotely Logging into Internal Network
Control Description: Scan all enterprise devices remotely logging into the organization's network prior to accessing the network to ensure that each of the organization's security policies has been enforced in the same manner as local network devices.

Control Short Name: Maintain an Inventory Sensitive Information
Control Long Name: Maintain an Inventory Sensitive Information
Control Description: Maintain an inventory of all sensitive information stored, processed, or transmitted by the organization's technology systems, including those located onsite or at a remote service provider.

Control Short Name: Remove Sensitive Data or Systems Not Regularly Accessed by Organization
Control Long Name: Remove Sensitive Data or Systems Not Regularly Accessed by Organization
Control Description: Remove sensitive data or systems not regularly accessed by the organization from the network. These systems shall only be used as stand alone systems (disconnected from the network) by the business unit needing to occasionally use the system or completely virtualized and powered off until needed.

Control Short Name: Monitor and Block Unauthorized Network Traffic
Control Long Name: Monitor and Block Unauthorized Network Traffic
Control Description: Deploy an automated tool on network perimeters that monitors for unauthorized transfer of sensitive information and blocks such transfers while alerting information security professionals.

Control Short Name: Only Allow Access to Authorized Cloud Storage or Email Providers
Control Long Name: Only Allow Access to Authorized Cloud Storage or Email Providers
Control Description: Only allow access to authorized cloud storage or email providers.

Control Short Name: Monitor and Detect Any Unauthorized Use of Encryption
Control Long Name: Monitor and Detect Any Unauthorized Use of Encryption
Control Description: Monitor all traffic leaving the organization and detect any unauthorized use of encryption.

Control Short Name: Encrypt the Hard Drive of All Mobile Devices.
Control Long Name: Encrypt the Hard Drive of All Mobile Devices.
Control Description: Utilize approved whole disk encryption software to encrypt the hard drive of all mobile devices.

Control Short Name: Manage USB Devices
Control Long Name: Manage USB Devices
Control Description: If USB storage devices are required, enterprise software should be used that can configure systems to allow the use of specific devices. An inventory of such devices should be maintained.

Control Short Name: Manage System's External Removable Media's Read/write Configurations
Control Long Name: Manage System's External Removable Media's Read/write Configurations
Control Description: Configure systems not to write data to external removable media, if there is no business need for supporting such devices.

Control Short Name: Encrypt Data on USB Storage Devices
Control Long Name: Encrypt Data on USB Storage Devices
Control Description: If USB storage devices are required, all data stored on such devices must be encrypted while at rest.

Control Short Name: Segment the Network Based on Sensitivity
Control Long Name: Segment the Network Based on Sensitivity
Control Description: Segment the network based on the label or classification level of the information stored on the servers, locate all sensitive information on separated Virtual Local Area Networks (VLANs).
Control Family: Controlled Access Based on the Need to Know

Control Short Name: Enable Firewall Filtering Between VLANs
Control Long Name: Enable Firewall Filtering Between VLANs
Control Description: Enable firewall filtering between VLANs to ensure that only authorized systems are able to communicate with other systems necessary to fulfill their specific responsibilities.
Control Family: Controlled Access Based on the Need to Know

Control Short Name: Disable Workstation to Workstation Communication
Control Long Name: Disable Workstation to Workstation Communication
Control Description: Disable all workstation to workstation communication to limit an attacker's ability to move laterally and compromise neighboring systems, through technologies such as Private VLANs or microsegmentation.
Control Family: Controlled Access Based on the Need to Know

Control Short Name: Encrypt All Sensitive Information in Transit
Control Long Name: Encrypt All Sensitive Information in Transit
Control Description: Encrypt all sensitive information in transit.
Control Family: Controlled Access Based on the Need to Know

Control Short Name: Utilize an Active Discovery Tool to Identify Sensitive Data
Control Long Name: Utilize an Active Discovery Tool to Identify Sensitive Data
Control Description: Utilize an active discovery tool to identify all sensitive information stored, processed, or transmitted by the organization's technology systems, including those located onsite or at a remote service provider and update the organization's sensitive information inventory.
Control Family: Controlled Access Based on the Need to Know

Control Short Name: Protect Information through  Access Control Lists
Control Long Name: Protect Information through  Access Control Lists
Control Description: Protect all information stored on systems with file system, network share, claims, application, or database specific access control lists. These controls will enforce the principle that only authorized individuals should have access to the information based on their need to access the information as a part of their responsibilities.
Control Family: Controlled Access Based on the Need to Know

Control Short Name: Enforce Access Control to Data through Automated Tools
Control Long Name: Enforce Access Control to Data through Automated Tools
Control Description: Use an automated tool, such as host-based Data Loss Prevention, to enforce access controls to data even when data is copied off a system.
Control Family: Controlled Access Based on the Need to Know

Control Short Name: Encrypt Sensitive Information at Rest
Control Long Name: Encrypt Sensitive Information at Rest
Control Description: Encrypt all sensitive information at rest using a tool that requires a secondary authentication mechanism not integrated into the operating system, in order to access the information.
Control Family: Controlled Access Based on the Need to Know

Control Short Name: Enforce Detail Logging for Access or Changes to Sensitive Data
Control Long Name: Enforce Detail Logging for Access or Changes to Sensitive Data
Control Description: Enforce detailed audit logging for access to sensitive data or changes to sensitive data (utilizing tools such as File Integrity Monitoring or Security Information and Event Monitoring).
Control Family: Controlled Access Based on the Need to Know

Control Short Name: Maintain an Inventory of Authorized Wireless Access Points
Control Long Name: Maintain an Inventory of Authorized Wireless Access Points
Control Description: Maintain an inventory of authorized wireless access points connected to the wired network.

Control Short Name: Detect Wireless Access Points Connected to the Wired Network
Control Long Name: Detect Wireless Access Points Connected to the Wired Network
Control Description: Configure network vulnerability scanning tools to detect and alert on unauthorized wireless access points connected to the wired network.

Control Short Name: Use a Wireless Intrusion Detection System
Control Long Name: Use a Wireless Intrusion Detection System
Control Description: Use a wireless intrusion detection system (WIDS) to detect and alert on unauthorized wireless access points connected to the network.

Control Short Name: Disable Wireless Access on Devices if Not Required
Control Long Name: Disable Wireless Access on Devices if Not Required
Control Description: Disable wireless access on devices that do not have a business purpose for wireless access.

Control Short Name: Limit Wireless Access on Client Devices
Control Long Name: Limit Wireless Access on Client Devices
Control Description: Configure wireless access on client machines that do have an essential wireless business purpose, to allow access only to authorized wireless networks and to restrict access to other wireless networks.

Control Short Name: Disable Peer-to-peer Wireless Network Capabilities on Wireless Clients
Control Long Name: Disable Peer-to-peer Wireless Network Capabilities on Wireless Clients
Control Description: Disable peer-to-peer (adhoc) wireless network capabilities on wireless clients.

Control Short Name: Leverage the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) to Encrypt Wireless Data
Control Long Name: Leverage the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) to Encrypt Wireless Data
Control Description: Leverage the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) to encrypt wireless data in transit.

Control Short Name: Use Wireless Authentication Protocols that Require Mutual, Multi-Factor Authentication
Control Long Name: Use Wireless Authentication Protocols that Require Mutual, Multi-Factor Authentication
Control Description: Ensure that wireless networks use authentication protocols such as Extensible Authentication Protocol-Transport Layer Security (EAP/TLS), that requires mutual, multi-factor authentication.

Control Short Name: Disable Wireless Peripheral Access of Devices
Control Long Name: Disable Wireless Peripheral Access of Devices
Control Description: Disable wireless peripheral access of devices (such as Bluetooth and NFC), unless such access is required for a business purpose.

Control Short Name: Create Separate Wireless Network for Personal and Untrusted Devices
Control Long Name: Create Separate Wireless Network for Personal and Untrusted Devices
Control Description: Create a separate wireless network for personal or untrusted devices. Enterprise access from this network should be treated as untrusted and filtered and audited accordingly.

Control Short Name: Maintain an Inventory of Authentication Systems
Control Long Name: Maintain an Inventory of Authentication Systems
Control Description: Maintain an inventory of each of the organization's authentication systems, including those located onsite or at a remote service provider.

Control Short Name: Configure Centralized Point of Authentication
Control Long Name: Configure Centralized Point of Authentication
Control Description: Configure access for all accounts through as few centralized points of authentication as possible, including network, security, and cloud systems.

Control Short Name: Require Multi-factor Authentication
Control Long Name: Require Multi-factor Authentication
Control Description: Require multi-factor authentication for all user accounts, on all systems, whether managed onsite or by a third-party provider.

Control Short Name: Encrypt or Hash all Authentication Credentials
Control Long Name: Encrypt or Hash all Authentication Credentials
Control Description: Encrypt or hash with a salt all authentication credentials when stored.

Control Short Name: Encrypt Transmittal of Username and Authentication Credentials
Control Long Name: Encrypt Transmittal of Username and Authentication Credentials
Control Description: Ensure that all account usernames and authentication credentials are transmitted across networks using encrypted channels.

Control Short Name: Maintain an Inventory of Accounts
Control Long Name: Maintain an Inventory of Accounts
Control Description: Maintain an inventory of all accounts organized by authentication system.

Control Short Name: Establish Process for Revoking Access
Control Long Name: Establish Process for Revoking Access
Control Description: Establish and follow an automated process for revoking system access by disabling accounts immediately upon termination or change of responsibilities of an employee or contractor . Disabling these accounts, instead of deleting accounts, allows preservation of audit trails.

Control Short Name: Disable Any Unassociated Accounts
Control Long Name: Disable Any Unassociated Accounts
Control Description: Disable any account that cannot be associated with a business process or business owner.

Control Short Name: Disable Dormant Accounts
Control Long Name: Disable Dormant Accounts
Control Description: Automatically disable dormant accounts after a set period of inactivity.

Control Short Name: Ensure All Accounts Have An Expiration Date
Control Long Name: Ensure All Accounts Have An Expiration Date
Control Description: Ensure that all accounts have an expiration date that is monitored and enforced.

Control Short Name: Lock Workstation Sessions After Inactivity
Control Long Name: Lock Workstation Sessions After Inactivity
Control Description: Automatically lock workstation sessions after a standard period of inactivity.

Control Short Name: Monitor Attempts to Access Deactivated Accounts
Control Long Name: Monitor Attempts to Access Deactivated Accounts
Control Description: Monitor attempts to access deactivated accounts through audit logging.

Control Short Name: Alert on Account Login Behavior Deviation
Control Long Name: Alert on Account Login Behavior Deviation
Control Description: Alert when users deviate from normal login behavior, such as time-of-day, workstation location and duration.

Control Short Name: Perform a Skills Gap Analysis
Control Long Name: Perform a Skills Gap Analysis
Control Description: Perform a skills gap analysis to understand the skills and behaviors workforce members are not adhering to, using this information to build a baseline education roadmap.
Control Family: Implement a Security Awareness and Training Program

Control Short Name: Deliver Training to Fill the Skills Gap
Control Long Name: Deliver Training to Fill the Skills Gap
Control Description: Deliver training to address the skills gap identified to positively impact workforce members' security behavior.
Control Family: Implement a Security Awareness and Training Program

Control Short Name: Implement a Security Awareness Program
Control Long Name: Implement a Security Awareness Program
Control Description: Create a security awareness program for all workforce members to complete on a regular basis to ensure they understand and exhibit the necessary behaviors and skills to help ensure the security of the organization. The organization's security awareness program should be communicated in a continuous and engaging manner.
Control Family: Implement a Security Awareness and Training Program

Control Short Name: Update Awareness Content Frequently
Control Long Name: Update Awareness Content Frequently
Control Description: Ensure that the organization's security awareness program is updated frequently (at least annually) to address new technologies, threats, standards and business requirements.
Control Family: Implement a Security Awareness and Training Program

Control Short Name: Train Workforce on Secure Authentication
Control Long Name: Train Workforce on Secure Authentication
Control Description: Train workforce members on the importance of enabling and utilizing secure authentication.
Control Family: Implement a Security Awareness and Training Program

Control Short Name: Train Workforce on Identifying Social Engineering Attacks
Control Long Name: Train Workforce on Identifying Social Engineering Attacks
Control Description: Train the workforce on how to identify different forms of social engineering attacks, such as phishing, phone scams and impersonation calls.
Control Family: Implement a Security Awareness and Training Program

Control Short Name: Train Workforce on Sensitive Data Handling
Control Long Name: Train Workforce on Sensitive Data Handling
Control Description: Train workforce on how to identify and properly store, transfer, archive and destroy sensitive information.
Control Family: Implement a Security Awareness and Training Program

Control Short Name: Train Workforce on Causes of Unintentional Data Exposure
Control Long Name: Train Workforce on Causes of Unintentional Data Exposure
Control Description: Train workforce members to be aware of causes for unintentional data exposures, such as losing their mobile devices or emailing the wrong person due to autocomplete in email.
Control Family: Implement a Security Awareness and Training Program

Control Short Name: Train Workforce Members on Identifying and Reporting Incidents
Control Long Name: Train Workforce Members on Identifying and Reporting Incidents
Control Description: Train employees to be able to identify the most common indicators of an incident and be able to report such an incident.
Control Family: Implement a Security Awareness and Training Program

Control Short Name: Establish Secure Coding Practices
Control Long Name: Establish Secure Coding Practices
Control Description: Establish secure coding practices appropriate to the programming language and development environment being used.

Control Short Name: Ensure Explicit Error Checking is Performed for All In-house Developed Software
Control Long Name: Ensure Explicit Error Checking is Performed for All In-house Developed Software
Control Description: For in-house developed software, ensure that explicit error checking is performed and documented for all input, including for size, data type, and acceptable ranges or formats.

Control Short Name: Verify That Acquired Software is Still Supported
Control Long Name: Verify That Acquired Software is Still Supported
Control Description: Verify that the version of all software acquired from outside your organization is still supported by the developer or appropriately hardened based on developer security recommendations.

Control Short Name: Only Use Up-to-date And Trusted Third-Party Components
Control Long Name: Only Use Up-to-date And Trusted Third-Party Components
Control Description: Only use up-to-date and trusted third-party components for the software developed by the organization.

Control Short Name: Use Only Standardized and Extensively Reviewed Encryption Algorithms
Control Long Name: Use Only Standardized and Extensively Reviewed Encryption Algorithms
Control Description: Use only standardized and extensively reviewed encryption algorithms.

Control Short Name: Ensure Software Development Personnel are Trained in Secure Coding
Control Long Name: Ensure Software Development Personnel are Trained in Secure Coding
Control Description: Ensure that all software development personnel receive training in writing secure code for their specific development environment and responsibilities.

Control Short Name: Apply Static and Dynamic Code Analysis Tools
Control Long Name: Apply Static and Dynamic Code Analysis Tools
Control Description: Apply static and dynamic analysis tools to verify that secure coding practices are being adhered to for internally developed software.

Control Short Name: Establish a Process to Accept and Address Reports of Software Vulnerabilities
Control Long Name: Establish a Process to Accept and Address Reports of Software Vulnerabilities
Control Description: Establish a process to accept and address reports of software vulnerabilities, including providing a means for external entities to contact your security group.

Control Short Name: Separate Production and Non-Production Systems
Control Long Name: Separate Production and Non-Production Systems
Control Description: Maintain separate environments for production and nonproduction systems. Developers should not have unmonitored access to production environments.

Control Short Name: Deploy Web Application Firewalls (WAFs)
Control Long Name: Deploy Web Application Firewalls (WAFs)
Control Description: Protect web applications by deploying web application firewalls (WAFs) that inspect all traffic flowing to the web application for common web application attacks. For applications that are not web-based, specific application firewalls should be deployed if such tools are available for the given application type. If the traffic is encrypted, the device should either sit behind the encryption or be capable of decrypting the traffic prior to analysis. If neither option is appropriate, a host-based web application firewall should be deployed.

Control Short Name: Use Standard Hardening Configuration Templates for Databases
Control Long Name: Use Standard Hardening Configuration Templates for Databases
Control Description: For applications that rely on a database, use standard hardening configuration templates. All systems that are part of critical business processes should also be tested.

Control Short Name: Document Incident Response Procedures
Control Long Name: Document Incident Response Procedures
Control Description: Ensure that there are written incident response plans that defines roles of personnel as well as phases of incident handling/management.

Control Short Name: Assign Job Titles and Duties for Incident Response
Control Long Name: Assign Job Titles and Duties for Incident Response
Control Description: Assign job titles and duties for handling computer and network incidents to specific individuals and ensure tracking and documentation throughout the incident through resolution.

Control Short Name: Designate Management Personnel to Support Incident Handling
Control Long Name: Designate Management Personnel to Support Incident Handling
Control Description: Designate management personnel, as well as backups, who will support the incident handling process by acting in key decision-making roles.

Control Short Name: Devise Organization-wide Standards for Reporting Incidents
Control Long Name: Devise Organization-wide Standards for Reporting Incidents
Control Description: Devise organization-wide standards for the time required for system administrators and other workforce members to report anomalous events to the incident handling team, the mechanisms for such reporting, and the kind of information that should be included in the incident notification.

Control Short Name: Maintain Contact Information For Reporting Security Incidents
Control Long Name: Maintain Contact Information For Reporting Security Incidents
Control Description: Assemble and maintain information on third-party contact information to be used to report a security incident, such as Law Enforcement, relevant government departments, vendors, and ISAC partners.

Control Short Name: Publish Information Regarding Reporting Computer Anomalies and Incidents
Control Long Name: Publish Information Regarding Reporting Computer Anomalies and Incidents
Control Description: Publish information for all workforce members, regarding reporting computer anomalies and incidents to the incident handling team. Such information should be included in routine employee awareness activities.

Control Short Name: Conduct Periodic Incident Scenario Sessions for Personnel
Control Long Name: Conduct Periodic Incident Scenario Sessions for Personnel
Control Description: Plan and conduct routine incident response exercises and scenarios for the workforce involved in the incident response to maintain awareness and comfort in responding to real world threats. Exercises should test communication channels, decision making, and incident responders technical capabilities using tools and data available to them.

Control Short Name: Create Incident Scoring and Prioritization Schema
Control Long Name: Create Incident Scoring and Prioritization Schema
Control Description: Create incident scoring and prioritization schema based on known or potential impact to your organization. Utilize score to define frequency of status updates and escalation procedures.

Control Short Name: Establish a Penetration Testing Program
Control Long Name: Establish a Penetration Testing Program
Control Description: Establish a program for penetration tests that includes a full scope of blended attacks, such as wireless, client-based, and web application attacks.
Control Family: Penetration Tests and Red Team Exercises

Control Short Name: Conduct Regular External and Internal Penetration Tests
Control Long Name: Conduct Regular External and Internal Penetration Tests
Control Description: Conduct regular external and internal penetration tests to identify vulnerabilities and attack vectors that can be used to exploit enterprise systems successfully.
Control Family: Penetration Tests and Red Team Exercises

Control Short Name: Perform Periodic Red Team Exercises
Control Long Name: Perform Periodic Red Team Exercises
Control Description: Perform periodic Red Team exercises to test organizational readiness to identify and stop attacks or to respond quickly and effectively.
Control Family: Penetration Tests and Red Team Exercises

Control Short Name: Include Tests for Presence of Unprotected System Information and Artifacts
Control Long Name: Include Tests for Presence of Unprotected System Information and Artifacts
Control Description: Include tests for the presence of unprotected system information and artifacts that would be useful to attackers, including network diagrams, configuration files, older penetration test reports, e-mails or documents containing passwords or other information critical to system operation.
Control Family: Penetration Tests and Red Team Exercises

Control Short Name: Create Test Bed for Elements Not Typically Tested in Production
Control Long Name: Create Test Bed for Elements Not Typically Tested in Production
Control Description: Create a test bed that mimics a production environment for specific penetration tests and Red Team attacks against elements that are not typically tested in production, such as attacks against supervisory control and data acquisition and other control systems.
Control Family: Penetration Tests and Red Team Exercises

Control Short Name: Use Vulnerability Scanning and Penetration Testing Tools in Concert
Control Long Name: Use Vulnerability Scanning and Penetration Testing Tools in Concert
Control Description: Use vulnerability scanning and penetration testing tools in concert. The results of vulnerability scanning assessments should be used as a starting point to guide and focus penetration testing efforts.
Control Family: Penetration Tests and Red Team Exercises

Control Short Name: Ensure Results from Penetration Test are Documented Using Open, Machine-readable Standards
Control Long Name: Ensure Results from Penetration Test are Documented Using Open, Machine-readable Standards
Control Description: Wherever possible, ensure that Red Teams results are documented using open, machine-readable standards (e.g., SCAP). Devise a scoring method for determining the results of Red Team exercises so that results can be compared over time.
Control Family: Penetration Tests and Red Team Exercises

Control Short Name: Control and Monitor Accounts Associated with Penetration Testing
Control Long Name: Control and Monitor Accounts Associated with Penetration Testing
Control Description: Any user or system accounts used to perform penetration testing should be controlled and monitored to make sure they are only being used for legitimate purposes, and are removed or restored to normal function after testing is over.
Control Family: Penetration Tests and Red Team Exercises
